divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving home down Stevens Creek blvd. As I reached the bottom of a hill, straight ahead of me was a black military helicopter. I could see there was something "floating" in front of it. As I got closer I could tell it was a black sphere approximately 5 feet in diameter. The helicopter and the sphere were "face to face". Just as I realized what I was seeing the black sphere took off in a Northerly direction towards Moffett Field Naval Airbase. The helicopter took off in pursuit and by the time I got around the corner both were gone and completely out of site. At first I thought the object was a bird. But as I got closer I could see an almost raised metal band around it. The object seemed to hover in a waving sort of motion. There were no lights on it that I could see. It was in the middle of the day. For those that might say it was the setting sun, since when is the sun black, 5 feet in diameter and takes off in a Northerly direction with a black military helicopter chasing it? This was no balloon, flare or any other object that the skeptics tend to attach to most ufos. I am very familiar with all kinds of Military and civilian aircract. I grew up around planes my whole life. I'm what you'd call an aircraft enthusiast. This was in no way a conventional aircraft. There was no visible propulsion and no wings whatsoever. It didn't strike me as an "occupied" vehicle. It seemed like it was being controlled remotely and intelligently.
